title: Dataforged
description: Describes game rules elements compatible with the Ironsworn: Starforged tabletop role-playing game by Shawn Tomkin.

Color.title: Color
Color.description: A CSS hexadecimal color. Use it to provide thematic accents when rendering this item.

SvgImageURL.title: Svg image url
SvgImageURL.description: A relative URL pointing to an SVG icon.

WebpImageURL.title: Webp image url
WebpImageURL.description: A relative URL pointing to a WEBP image.

Source.title: Source
Source.description: Metadata describing the source of this item's text content

title.description: The title of the source document.

page.description: The page number on which this item appears most prominently, if applicable.

url.description: The URL where the source document is available.

date.description: The date of the source documents's last update, formatted YYYY-MM-DD. Required because it's used to determine whether the data needs updating.

license.description: An absolute URL pointing to the location where this element's license can be found. If it's "null", no license is provided -- use with caution.

Label.title: Label
Label.description: A localized plain text name or label.

AssetConditionMeterControlFieldID.title: Asset condition meter control field ID

shared.description: Most assets only benefit to their owner, but certain assets (like Starforged's module and command vehicle assets) are shared amongst the player's allies, too.

count_as_impact.description: If `true`, this asset counts as an impact (Starforged) or a debility (classic Ironsworn).

AssetAttachment.title: Asset attachment
AssetAttachment.description: Describes which assets can be attached to this asset. The "canonical" example for this are Starforged's Module assets, which can be equipped by Command Vehicle assets. See p. 55 of Starforged for more info.

max.title: Maximum attached assets
max.description: Omitted if there's no upper limit to the number of attached assets.

assets.title: Attachable assets
assets.description: Asset IDs (which may be wildcards) that may be attached to this asset

moves.description: Unique moves added by this asset ability.

contents.description: The elements contained by this collection.

count_as_impact.description: If `true`, this asset counts as an impact (Starforged) or a debility (classic Ironsworn).

content_type.description:
'range' displays the number range: 'low' to 'high'.

'result', 'summary', and 'description' display the string value from the OracleTableRow's corresponding key.

'range' displays the number range: 'low' to 'high'.

'result', 'summary', and 'description' display the string value from the OracleTableRow's corresponding key.

table_key.description: A key from OracleCollection#contents, indicating which OracleTable's data is used in this column.

style.description:
The style used to render this table in the source material.

        * embed_as_column: This table appears as a column of a table handled by its OracleCollection parent.
        * embed_in_row: This table appears in its entirety within the row of another table. Canonical examples appear in the Ironsworn Rulebook and Ironsworn: Delve.
        * table: A standard table, typically with a roll column and a result column.

match.title: Oracle match behavior
match.description: A handful of oracles have special behavior on a match.

times.description: The number of times to roll.

OracleTableRollMethod.title: Oracle table roll method
OracleTableRollMethod.description:
no_duplicates = Reroll duplicate OracleTableRows
  allow_duplicates = Don't reroll duplicate OracleTableRows
  make_it_worse = Don't reroll duplicate OracleTableRows; duplicates compound.

OracleTableRow.title: Oracle table row
OracleTableRow.description: Represents a row from an oracle table.

low.description: The low end of this row's roll range

high.description: The high end of this row's roll range

summary.title: Summary text
summary.description:
A secondary markdown string that must be presented to the user for the implementation to be complete, but may benefit from progressive disclosure (such as a collapsible element, popover/tooltip, etc).

`null` is used in cases where an 'empty' `OracleTableRow#summary` exists (example: Starship Type, Starforged rulebook p. 326). In the book, these table cells are rendered with the text `--` (and this is the recommended placeholder for tabular display). For display as a single result (e.g. VTT roll output), however, `null` values can be safely omitted.

description.title: Extended description
description.description: An extended description for this oracle table row. No canonical OracleTableRows use it, but some TruthOptions do.

embed_table.description: A table to be rendered inside this table row.

OracleRollTemplate.title: Oracle roll template
OracleRollTemplate.description:
Provides string templates that may be used in place of the static row text from `OracleTableRow#result`, `OracleTableRow#summary`, and `OracleTableRow#description`.

These strings are formatted in Markdown, but use a special syntax for their placeholders: `{{result:some_oracle_table_id}}`. The placeholder should be replaced with the value of a rolled (or selected) `OracleTableRow#result` from the target oracle table ID.

result.description: A string template that may be used in place of OracleTableRow#result.

summary.description: A string template that may be used in place of OracleTableRow#summary.

description.description: A string template that may be used in place of OracleTableRow#description.

contents.description: The elements contained by this collection.

rendering.description: Some oracle collections are rendered as a single table in the source material. If so, parameters for rendering that table are included here.

^[a-z_]+$.description: A column's default label is the title of the source table.

PlayerConditionMeter.title: Player condition meter
PlayerConditionMeter.description: A standard player character condition meter.

PlayerConditionMeterID.title: Player condition meter ID
PlayerConditionMeterID.description: ID for a standard player character condition meter.

EncounterStarforged.title: Encounter (Starforged)
EncounterStarforged.description: An encounter entry similar to those in Chapter 4 of Ironsworn: Starforged.

quest_starter.description: A localizable markdown string describing the quest starter associated with this item.

MoveID.title: Move ID
MoveID.description: A move ID, for a standard move or a unique asset move

contents.description: The elements contained by this collection.

MoveRollMethod.title: Move roll method
MoveRollMethod.description:
`any`: When rolling with this move trigger option, the player picks which stat to use.

`all`: When rolling with this move trigger option, *every* stat or progress track of the `using` key is rolled.

`highest`: When rolling with this move trigger option, use the highest/best option from the `using` key.

`lowest`: When rolling with this move trigger option, use the lowest/worst option from the `using` key.

TriggerRollOptionActionChoiceRef.title: Trigger roll option action choice ref
TriggerRollOptionActionChoiceRef.description: An action roll that references a value provided by an asset

ref.description: Identifies the stat whose value is to be referenced.

TriggerRollOptionActionChoiceStat.title: Trigger roll option action choice stat

TriggerRollOptionActionChoiceCustomValue.title: Trigger roll option action choice custom value

TriggerRollOptionActionChoiceAttachedAss.title: Trigger roll option action choice attached asset ref

using.description: Use the condition meter value of the asset that this asset is attached to.

TriggerRollOptionAction.title: Roll option for action roll trigger

method.description:
The method this move trigger uses to select which stat(s) or progress track(s) are rolled. If this is a MoveOutcomeType, then it simply takes that result automatically rather than making a roll.

If this is `null`, this trigger option describes no rolls of its own, and should inherit the roll method of another trigger option the extended move.

choices.title: Trigger option choices
choices.description:
The stat choices allowed by this trigger option.

If this is `null`, it should inherit the value of another trigger option for the extended move.

by.title: Triggered by
by.description: Information on who can trigger this trigger option. Usually this is just the player, but some asset abilities can trigger from an ally's move.

TriggerRollOptionProgress.title: Roll option for progress roll trigger

method.description:
The method this move trigger uses to select which stat(s) or progress track(s) are rolled. If this is a MoveOutcomeType, then it simply takes that result automatically rather than making a roll.

If this is `null`, this trigger option describes no rolls of its own, and should inherit the roll method of another trigger option the extended move.

choices.title: Trigger option choices

items.title: Trigger choice (progress roll)
items.description: A choice belonging to a progress trigger option (which belongs in turn to a progress move).

choices.description:
The stat choices allowed by this trigger option.

If this is `null`, it should inherit the value of another trigger option for the extended move.

by.title: Triggered by
by.description: Information on who can trigger this trigger option. Usually this is just the player, but some asset abilities can trigger from an ally's move.

text.description:
A markdown string containing the primary trigger text for this move.

Secondary trigger text (for specific stats or uses of an asset ability) may be described described in Trigger#roll_options.

roll_options.description: Action roll options for triggering this move.

items.title: Roll option for action roll trigger

If this is `null`, this trigger option describes no rolls of its own, and should inherit the roll method of another trigger option the extended move.

roll_options.title: Trigger options (progress move)
roll_options.description: Progress roll options for triggering this move.

MoveExtension.title: Move extension
MoveExtension.description: Upgrades or otherwise modifies one or more moves.

extends.description: Move IDs affected by this move extension

ProgressType.title: Progress type
ProgressType.description: Standard progress track types found in Ironsworn: Starforged.

Suggestions.title: Suggestions
Suggestions.description: Related items that can be presented as useful shortcuts.

ruleset.description: The ruleset (Starforged or Classic ironsworn) that these elements are for.

_source.description: Source information to be inherited by all eligible descendants. Descendant '_source' properties will override only the properties they specify; use the 'source' property if you'd prefer to replace the entire object.
